SUB_C01_GMCK_MIDO_EMERALDRIDE_000_CUT_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_GMCK_MIDO_EMERALDRIDE_000_CUT_00.text:
Well, heck. Look at this weird little guy.
Feels like I've seen him somewhere before...
Maybe he popped up in a movie I saw with Dad?
Or he's a monster I ran into somewhere?

SUB_C01_GMCK_MIDO_TRADEDRUM_000_CUT_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_GMCK_MIDO_TRADEDRUM_000_CUT_000_.text:
Now what the cripes is this doing here? I mean,
it's obviously a washing machine, but this is
no place for people to be doing chores.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_SIUGNAS_000_CUT_000_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_SIUGNAS_000_CUT_000_00.text: At last, I have regained my true form!

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_SIUGNAS_000_CUT_000_01.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_SIUGNAS_000_CUT_000_01.text:
Huh. So you really are the Dismal King.
Easy to tell that much, 'cause you've
got darkness just dripping off you.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_SIUGNAS_000_CUT_000_02.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_SIUGNAS_000_CUT_000_02.text:
So you say. Yet at this point, I have reclaimed
but a fraction of my power. Now guard me well,
for I am still quite some way from returning
to my true and complete self.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_ERYTHEIA_000_CUT_000_0.speaker: Erytheia
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_ERYTHEIA_000_CUT_000_0.text:
Oh boy. Oooh boy. Is this what
it's like outside of the Kosmos? Please, Canker! Pinch my cellular wall
and wake me from this horrid nightmare!
I don't want to be alone here!

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_ERYTHEIA_000_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_ERYTHEIA_000_CUT_000_0.text:
Hey there, Erytheia. What're you getting
up to in a place like this? Did you manage
to get rid of Canker?

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_ERYTHEIA_000_CUT_000_0.speaker: Erytheia
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_ERYTHEIA_000_CUT_000_0.text:
Foreign body detected! Oh, thank goodness!
Well, I have no use for Canker anymore.
Aaaaaand away you go!

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_ERYTHEIA_000_CUT_000_0.speaker: Erytheia
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_ERYTHEIA_000_CUT_000_0.text:
Now let us sally forth together!
You and I will need to get used to
being in the same boat, as it were.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_00.text:
I heard the Heavens were on the other side
of the stone gate, but I didn't think everyone
meant it so...literally.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_01.speaker: Familiar_Voice
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_01.text:
Greetings, Tsunanori. If you are hearing
this message, it means you managed to
pass through the stone gate.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_02.text: Heck, that's Uncle Tadamichi! So he left a message inside one of the kugutsu, eh? Guess this means everything's going just like the guy planned.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_03.speaker: Tadamichi_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_03.text:
Long ago, our family supported our country's
emperor in visiting peace and order upon
the land. Since then, however, the world
has changed, and our power has been lost.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_04.speaker: Tadamichi_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_04.text:
Wicked forces are taking advantage of that opening
in an attempt to devour our country...and our world. This is not a matter that can be left to government—
and as a government official myself, I assure you
I do not make such a statement lightly.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_05.speaker: Tadamichi_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_05.text:
It is the duty of our family to vanquish evil,
but this cannot be achieved without power.
As such, we must reclaim what we have lost.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_06.speaker: Tadamichi_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_06.text: You must scour the Heavens for beings of power, transfer that power into your kugutsu, and return it to us. You will need to find four such beings to stem the spread of evil.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_07.speaker: Tadamichi_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_07.text: To be perfectly frank, I know very little of the Heavens, and we have no way of predicting what might happen there. But I trust in your capability, Tsunanori. Use your kugutsu well.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_08.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_08.text: Well, there's a surprise right off the bat. Sure hope I can use these kugutsu as well as Uncle Tadamichi thinks I can.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_010_00.speaker: Tadamichi_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_010_00.text:
You have been chosen, Tsunanori.
Chosen to save our country—and our world.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_010_01.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_010_01.text:
'Chosen'? The heck with that, guy.
I chose this path myself.

SUB_C01_EVAR_MIDO_FIRST_PORTAL_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVAR_MIDO_FIRST_PORTAL_000_CUT_0.text:
Doesn't matter if I push or if I pull.
This thing won't budge.

SUB_C01_EVAR_MIDO_FIRST_PORTAL_000_CUT_0.speaker: Musashi_Kugutu
SUB_C01_EVAR_MIDO_FIRST_PORTAL_000_CUT_0.text:
If I may, I believe that door will not
open unless something is done about
this contraption first.

SUB_C01_EVAR_MIDO_FIRST_PORTAL_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVAR_MIDO_FIRST_PORTAL_000_CUT_0.text:
Hey! Look what I just found
lying on the floor.

SUB_C01_EVAR_MIDO_FIRST_PORTAL_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVAR_MIDO_FIRST_PORTAL_000_CUT_0.text:
You figure pluggin' in this triangular
deal here will do the trick?

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_00.text:
I thought the Heavens were supposed to be on the other
side of the stone gate. Doesn't look like I thought it would,
but... Eh, who knows? Maybe this is just what the Heavens
really looked like all along.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_01.speaker: Familiar_Voice
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_01.text:
Hey there, Son. If you're hearing this
message, it means you managed to
get through the stone gate.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_02.text: Dad! Guess he must've left a message inside one of the kugutsu. But, uh... Why?

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_03.speaker: Masatsuna_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_03.text:
Since there wasn't anyone qualified in the generation
before yours, you've been sent to the Heavens by special
request of the Mido family head. Oh, and Uncle Tadamichi
pushed real hard for you, too, so that's nice.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_04.speaker: Masatsuna_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_04.text:
Anyway, this whole deal is happening because of
what went down during the war—and while I know
it's not right to dump that on you, somebody's
gotta carry out the family's duty.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_05.speaker: Masatsuna_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_05.text:
I never got a chance to teach you much but
the basics, but you've always been a real
smart kid—and I bet my left foot you'll be
better than your old man at this by supper.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_06.speaker: Masatsuna_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_06.text: So here's the deal: beings of power live in the Heavens. We need you to transfer their power into your kugutsu and bring 'em home to Miyako City. Oh, and we need four to save everyone. Okay, bud?

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_07.speaker: Masatsuna_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_07.text:
I'm sorry as heck to lay all this at your feet,
but there it is. Just think of it as doing what
you can to save your friends and family, eh?
Now hang in there, Son...and come home safe.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_08.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_100_CUT_000_08.text:
Beings of power, eh? Well, heck.
Wonder where I'll find those fellas.

SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_INITIAL_WAVE_100_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_INITIAL_WAVE_100_CUT_0.text:
The Wave's connected to four different doors.
Guess I should've expected this, but how is a guy
supposed to go about deciding where to go first?

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_FIRST_PORTAL_100_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_FIRST_PORTAL_100_CUT_0.text:
Am I sure this is the door I want?
It's a heck of a decision here...

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_FIRST_PORTAL_100_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_FIRST_PORTAL_100_CUT_0.text: Maybe not. Let's think about this.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_00.text:
So these are the Heavens, eh?
...Sorta weird, but part of me
feels like I've been here before.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_01.speaker: Familiar_Voice
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_01.text:
Greetings, Tsunanori. If you are hearing this,
it can only mean one thing: you have managed
to reach the Heavens.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_02.text: Mother! How in the heck did she manage to plant a message inside a kugutsu? Boy howdy, things sure got weird fast.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_03.speaker: Tadako_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_03.text:
Stubbornly stuck in the ancient ways, our country
lost the war and was left teetering on the brink.
But if responsibility for that lies anywhere,
it lies with men who have since passed.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_04.speaker: Tadako_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_04.text:
I married into the Mido family from one of the house's branch
lineages—something that would have been unthinkable before the war.
It was eventually allowed out of fear that we would be unable to survive
unless we discarded the shackles of our timeworn customs.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_05.speaker: Tadako_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_05.text:
You represent a new stage of the Mido family,
Tsunanori—a Mido family in which the lineages
have now been made whole.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_06.speaker: Tadako_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_06.text: I need you to search for four spirits—four beings of power said to reside in the Heavens. Instill their power in your kugutsu, and guide us into a new era.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_07.speaker: Tadako_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_07.text:
I know not what challenges await you in
the Heavens, but I trust you will overcome
them and shoulder the burden placed upon
you with your typical aplomb.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_08.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_08.text:
Yeesh. It's just like her to roll in
and lay on the pressure like that.
If she held my feet any closer to the
fire, I could use 'em to roast veggies.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_09.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_000_09.text: Guess this is my first challenge. Sure hope I can pull this off, but I guess that depends on my kugutsu.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_010_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_200_CUT_010_00.text:
If that's how my adventure's starting,
I bet the path ahead is gonna be rougher
than a back road in winter.

SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_INITIAL_WAVE_200_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_INITIAL_WAVE_200_CUT_0.text:
Two doors, eh? Wonder which one
I should go for here.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_00.text:
So these are the Heavens, eh? Well, I can
breathe just fine, so I guess I haven't
wandered into outer space or something.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_01.speaker: Familiar_Voice
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_01.text:
Greetings, Tsunanori. If you are hearing
this message, it means you managed to
pass through the stone gate.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_02.text: Heck, that's Uncle Tadamichi! So he left a message inside one of the kugutsu, eh? Guess this means everything's going just like the guy planned.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_03.speaker: Tadamichi_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_03.text:
Our country is in peril—a fact one of your
generation surely feels even more keenly
than myself. Hope dwindles by the day,
and the people feel trapped and helpless.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_04.speaker: Tadamichi_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_04.text:
But I believe in you, Tsunanori. I trust
you possess the strength to overcome even
the worst of circumstances and take that
first, crucial step toward the future.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_05.speaker: Tadamichi_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_05.text:
The Heavens are home to four beings of power.
I want you to find them, acquire their strength,
and return home. If you do this, their power
will become a guiding ray of light for us all.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_06.speaker: Tadamichi_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_06.text:
I have known you since you were just a baby,
Tsunanori, and when I think of how you now
have the courage to charge headlong into
adversity, it fills me with pride as a Mido.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_07.speaker: Tadamichi_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_07.text:
I know not what might await you in the Heavens.
And while this may come off as a flippant way
to sum up the situation ahead...I truly hope
you enjoy your adventures in the other worlds.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_08.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_09.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_000_09.text:
Whoa! That was fast. Well, here's hopin'
I find some kind of enjoyment here.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_010_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_300_CUT_010_00.text:
Can't really say I enjoyed that, but it
was better than a swift kick in the rear.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_1SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_00.speaker: Lita_Caryx
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_1SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_00.text:
So this is my second time coming to the Lost
Realms, and I can't say I'm excited to be back.
Honestly, this is the kind of place nobody
should ever have to come to.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_1SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_01.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_1SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_01.text:
Now hold on just a second there.
Did you call this place 'the Lost Realms'?
I thought these here were the Heavens—
place the gods live and all that?

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_1SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_02.speaker: Lita_Caryx
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_1SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_02.text: We call them the Lost Realms because of how easy it is to lose your way here. Also, witches don't acknowledge the existence of supernatural beings like... Ick. Gods.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_1SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_03.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_1SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_03.text:
Not really the church-goin' types, eh?
Yeah, I feel you there—heck, it's not
like I've ever met any gods myself.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_1SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_04.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_1SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_04.text:
Still, this place looks a heck of a lot
different than it did when I first popped
over through the Ama-no-Iwato Cave.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_1SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_05.speaker: Lita_Caryx
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_1SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_05.text:
The Lost Realms don't really have a fixed
appearance—or at least that's the impression
I got from listening to stories from all the
witches who've passed through here.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_1SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_06.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_1SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_06.text:
Yep, this place is kind of wild, all right.
Anyway, suppose we better get to figuring
out which door to go through next.

SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.speaker: Lita_Caryx
SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.text:
Okay, THAT was weird. That pose you did?
What's that about?

SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.text:
Yowch. I mean, I've always made a point of
not doing my pose in front of other folks,
but I figured a witch might be a bit more
understanding about the whole deal.

SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.speaker: Lita_Caryx
SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.text:
Eh, everybody's got their quirks. That said,
I'd definitely avoid letting someone you're
romantically interested in see you pull off
smooth moves like that. What was that little ritual
even about, anyway?

SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.text:
So not even witches can see
the Emerald Wave, huh?

SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.text:
Guess you'd say it shows me
the path I'm meant to travel. See, when I was a kid, I used to feel like my
whole life had already been laid out for me.
Didn't much care for that to be honest,
so I'd usually go anywhere but where it told me.

SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.text:
But now, I feel like it helps keep me grounded
when the stakes are high. Even when I've got
other folks' hopes and dreams riding on me,
it lets me stay focused and determined.

SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.speaker: Lita_Caryx
SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.text:
Huh. I think I'm starting to understand why
the Arch Witch ordered me to join you...
Well, don't worry about me—you just keep
posing like crazy and follow that destiny.

SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.text: Much as I'd love to do that, I've actually got three strands of the Emerald Wave poppin' out at me right now—the thickest one being the suggested fate. You got a read on this, maybe? Which one should I go for?

SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.speaker: Lita_Caryx
SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.text: Sorry, someone's suggesting a fate? Ugh. What a contrived mess.

SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.speaker: Lita_Caryx
SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.text:
Well, I'm a road-less-traveled kind of girl,
so how about we go for whichever one looks
the thinnest? That's the fate being pushed
the least, right?

SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_1SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.text:
Had a feelin' you'd say that, bud.
I don't much care for doing what I'm
told either, so let's make it happen.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_2SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_2SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_00.text:
I still need another two spirits.
Just gotta repeat the process, I guess.

SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_2SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_2SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.text:
Well, I was expecting the Emerald Wave to
show me two strands, but I'm seeing three.
Third one's red as all get out, too.

SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_2SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.speaker: Lita_Caryx
SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_2SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.text: Sounds like a warning to me.

SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_2SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_2SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.text:
Sure does. Where I'm from, red means
you should stop because there's something
bad up ahead.

SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_2SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.speaker: Lita_Caryx
SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_2SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.text:
So I guess you either ignore distractions in 
order to fulfill your mission, or give in to
curiosity and explore an unknown door? Heh. Fate sure seems to enjoy
playing games with you, huh?

SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_2SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_2SPIRIT_WAVE_000_CUT_0.text:
Hey, quit pokin' fun. I've seriously
got no idea what to do here.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_3SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_3SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_00.text:
We're gettin' close to the end here.
Just gotta stay the path.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_4SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_4SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_00.text:
All that's left to do is head
back to Miyako City.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_000.text:
It's time to head back to Miyako City,
and I can't wait. But first things first...

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_010.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_010.text:
You've done an admirable job gathering
the power of four spirits.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_020.text:
Who the heck are you, fella—and how do
you know about the spirits? Seeing as you
were waiting for me in a place like this,
I'm guessing you're not some average Joe.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_030.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_030.text:
You have asked a great many questions,
little scion—questions I do not believe
you require the answers to.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_000.text:
Fella talked a big game, but he wasn't
much to write home about in the end.
Wonder what his deal was?

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_010.speaker: Lita_Caryx
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_010.text:
Hey, weren't you in the middle
of saying something before we
got pulled into that fight?

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_030.text:
Well, I can't thank everyone enough for
helping me track down spirits. And while
I really appreciate it, I'm afraid this is where
we're gonna have to part ways.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_040.text:
Thing is, Miyako City is closed off from
other worlds—which is why I never would've
imagined so many worlds were so closely
connected before going on this crazy journey.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_050.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_050.text:
There'd be trouble if you came to Miyako City. The government
would be eager as all get-out to grab you and run a bunch of weird
experiments, and my uncle would lead the charge. Can't be havin'
you go through that, you know? Better that we split now.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_060.speaker: Lita_Caryx
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_060.text:
Okay, are you serious right now?
You got what you wanted and now
you're kicking us to the curb?

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_070.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_070.text:
It makes me sound like a class-A jerk when you put
it that way, but yeah, I guess that's about the long
and short of it. Sorry if it makes you cranky, but I'm
confident it's best for us to go our separate ways.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_080.speaker: Lita_Caryx
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_080.text:
I'm kidding, Tsunanori. I'm well aware that you
come from an isolated world. Sort of a shame,
though—I've always wanted to visit Miyako City.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_100.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_100.text:
You can bet on it.
Can't say when, though.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_120.speaker: Musashi_Kugutu
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_120.text: We are with you always, Tsunanori.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_140.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_010_140.text:
Now let's get ourselves home.
Miyako City awaits.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_000.text:
It's time to head back to Miyako City,
and I can't wait. But first things first...

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Lita_Caryx
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_010.text:
Hey! Do NOT tell me you're going
to try and get rid of us here.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_020.text:
Actually, yeah. That was the plan.
But now I've got this bad feeling
I can't seem to shake. It's like some little tickle telling me
I'm going to need everyone's help to
take on whatever's waiting back home.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_030.speaker: Lita_Caryx
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_030.text:
Well, we've come this far together,
and I think I speak for everybody
when I say we'd regret not seeing
the thing through to the bitter end.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_000_040.text:
Fair enough. Er, but try not to stand out
too much, all right? Oh, and don't let it
bother you if folks stare like you just
grew a second head, yeah?

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_001_010.speaker: Dolores
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_001_010.text:
Please don't say we will part ways here!
Oh, but I would simply hate that!

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_001_030.speaker: Dolores
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_001_030.text:
I would follow you to the ends of any
world, Master! There is no danger great
enough to drive me from your side!

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_002_010.speaker: Gold_SubManager
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_002_010.text:
Hold it right there, pal. You'd best not
be thinking about not taking us to this
Miyako City of yours.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_002_030.speaker: Gold_SubManager
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_002_030.text:
I'm here to enjoy life in Outside,
so don't go ruining my fun!

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_003_010.speaker: BX10_EX
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_003_010.text:
Have you determined that foreign elements
must not be introduced to Miyako City?

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_003_030.speaker: BX10_EX
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_003_030.text:
Is this the judgment of the Emerald Wave
only you can see? If so, I suggest you do
as it says, for it has yet to lead you astray.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_004_010.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_004_010.text:
Pah! Does your pathetic home truly
have no use for the Dismal King?

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_004_030.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_004_030.text:
Well, you may be at ease, for I've no
intention of wreaking havoc upon it.
All I desire is to reclaim my power
and return to my own castle.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_006_010.speaker: Erytheia
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_006_010.text:
Hm? Wait, are you trying to say
we'll be splitting up here?

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_007_010.speaker: YellowWitchWillma
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_007_010.text:
Do you believe it is time for us
to go our separate ways, Watcher?

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_007_030.speaker: YellowWitchWillma
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_007_030.text:
While you should always pay heed to such 
premonitions, I'd ask you not to worry:
the power of the witches of Pulchra
will be plenty of help in a pinch!

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_008_010.speaker: SquireAssasin
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_008_010.text:
Has this humble squire's role in your
adventure come to an end, O Watcher?

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_008_030.speaker: SquireAssasin
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_008_030.text:
Then we must give that hunch the utmost
consideration! However, I feel certain
I would be of tremendous aid in whatever
ordeals may lie ahead.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_110_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_110_CUT_000_020.text:
Actually, yeah. I've got this bad feeling
I can't seem to shake—some little tickle
telling me I'm going to need everyone's help
to take on whatever's waiting back home.

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_REENTER_200_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_REENTER_200_CUT_000_00.text:
Where'd that fella get to?
I won't let him escape!

SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_REENTER_300_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_WRLD_MIDO_REENTER_300_CUT_000_00.text:
Who the heck is gettin'
in my way now, huh?

SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_REENTER_300_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_SCAN_MIDO_REENTER_300_CUT_000_00.text:
Having me make the choices
up to the end, eh?

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.text:
I believe I bade you farewell.
What are you doing here?

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.text:
Thing is, I'm not completely convinced that
cutting Miyako City off from the rest of the
worlds is such a hot idea, so I swung back by
to see if I could find some answers.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.text:
Did you now? In any case, the answers you seek exist within Miyako City.
But let me ask you this: do you believe Miyako City to be a place of such
inherent value that it should continue to exist? If the answer is yes,
it must be separated from the Conjoined Worlds.
If no, it must be cut loose so as to not contaminate them.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.text:
Not really much of a choice there.
You're saying it's gotta be cut loose
no matter what, basically?

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.text:
Just so. The path before you is clear: return
to Miyako City, destroy the stone gate with
a clear conscience, and separate it from the
Conjoined Worlds. This is the answer you seek.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.text:
Well, the Emerald Wave is pointing me toward
that door over there, so if what you're saying
is true, it must lead to Miyako City.
Guess I'll be off then.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.text:
Hold! Do you truly perceive the Emerald
Wave to be guiding you to that door?

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.text:
No need to repeat what I just said right
back at me, bud. Also, I'm guessing you
don't want me taking that door?

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.text:
...No, perhaps it is fine. I must admit,
there is a part of me that wishes to see
what might transpire when you face the true
nature of the worlds that surround us.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_000.text:
Don't really care for the creepy look on your face
right now, fella. Well, whatever. It's pretty clear
the answers I'm out here looking for are all on
the other side of that door.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_010.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_010.text:
You were born of the very laws which govern the worlds
around us, and sent to Miyako City with the purpose of
separating it from the Conjoined Worlds. Only by doing
so can the purity of all worlds be maintained.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_010.text:
You talk plenty about separation and purity and all that,
but Miyako City's ALREADY been influenced by other
worlds. I mean, it might be changing at a lazy snail's
pace, but it IS changing. And you know what?
I think that's fine. Change keeps life interesting.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_010.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_010.text:
What you call change, we call contamination.
Other worlds will be infected, and to simply be 'fine'
with such is the utmost expression of pure insolence.
I cannot imagine the laws of our worlds will take kindly to it.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_010.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_010.text:
Yet that you might return here was most unexpected indeed,
for you are the first child in all history who has managed to
climb back into the womb. I greatly look forward to seeing
how the worlds will react to this most unusual of situations.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_020.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_020.text:
So you mean to reject the very laws
that govern our existence!? Madness!
Surely you don't believe such brazen
insolence will go unpunished!?

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_020.text:
Thought you said you were looking forward to
seeing how this would turn out, guy. Sorta sad
to hear you change your tune now that things
aren't working out like you hoped.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_030.text:
So that thing gave birth to me so I could
separate Miyako City from the Heavens, huh?
I guess me not wanting to cut it loose is
like a baby holding onto its umbilical cord.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_030.speaker: Musashi_Kugutu
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_030.text:
I disagree, Tsunanori; I believe you
did a fine job of severing the cord
by your own hand.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_030.speaker: Komachi_Kugutu
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_030.text:
Indeed, you are the only one
who can decide your fate.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_030.speaker: Sukune_Kugutu
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_030.text: We are but kugutsu, and we will abide whatever choices you make.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_030.speaker: Bou_Kugutu
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_030.text:
C'mon, Tsunanori. Live a little!
Make whatever choice seems interesting.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_030.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_300_CUT_030.text:
Yeah, it'd be a bummer to go through life
bored out of my skull...so nuts to that!
Let's jump outta Miyako City and go explore
all sorts of worlds!

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_000.text: So you're originally from here, huh?

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_000.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_000.text:
I thought you might return; you are not the type
to attempt to save your world alone, for you have
been gifted with the power to lead all the worlds
to a single, unified future.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_000.text:
Yeah, that's none of my business—I'm just out here
figurin' out what I'm supposed to do, and I came to
the Heavens looking for answers. This is where it
all started, so I figure it's the best place to look.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_000.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_000.text:
Just so. You were born here, then sent to
Miyako City. After growing up, you journeyed
across various worlds, became more powerful,
and finally returned to your point of origin.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_000.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_000.text:
The Conjoined Worlds are one, and one world is enough.
You see the beautiful Emerald Wave, yes? The world you've
chosen lies at the end. Now go forth and guide all the worlds
beyond into that emerald glow.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_000.text:
So the answers I'm looking for are on the other side of that door?
Well, that's fine and dandy for me, but I feel like I shouldn't force
other folks to come along for the ride. I mean, there are a lot of
doors out there, so what's wrong with just lettin' folks go through
whichever one they like best?

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_000.text:
Heck, the worlds I saw were all so different, I doubt there's
a way to fit 'em all into a single world and make it all work.
Each world should be free to go its own way. That'd suit me
just fine too—I've still got my own place I call home anyway.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_000.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_000.text:
So you refuse to guide us beyond that door?
You would abandon the worlds and their peoples so you
might be allowed to simply flit about wherever you please?
If such is your answer, then I must deem you a failure—
and failures cannot be permitted to pass through the door.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_000.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_000.text:
It was your purpose to give birth to a new,
radiant Conjoined Worlds. I know not how
you could have failed us so spectacularly,
but I intend to end this farce now.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_010.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_010.text:
This world of chaos is an utter failure.
A world cannot be complete unless properly
governed by beautiful rules of order.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_010.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_010.text:
Beauty's in the eye of the beholder, guy—
and the last thing I want is a world based
entirely around your messed-up values.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_010.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_010.text:
And what do YOU intend!? What beauty can there
possibly be in a world selfishly devised by people so
lacking in ideals!? What radiance can there be!? What joy!? No, happiness can be found only when you first submit
to order, and I will not permit one such as you to bring
the worlds to ruin!

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_020.text:
Well, looks like taking that thing out didn't cause
the Heavens to fall apart, which'll help me sleep
easier at night. Also, I guess that means there
wasn't a god who created the Heavens after all.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_020.speaker: Musashi_Kugutu
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_020.text:
Perhaps not. However, it may yet be the
kind of place that births beings such as
the one we encountered. And in that case,
Tsunanori, what will you do?

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_020.text: Don't sweat it, guy. Dealing with stuff like that as it comes is why we've got a Mido family—and why we've got you kugutsu.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_020.text:
Now c'mon. We've got a door
to walk through.

SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_020.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_EVNT_MIDO_LASTBATTLE_310_CUT_020.text:
Where else? The place we're
meant to return to.

SUB_C01_GMCK_MIDO_EMERALDRIDE_000_CUT_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_C01_GMCK_MIDO_EMERALDRIDE_000_CUT_00.text: Again? What is it this time?

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_011.speaker: Unknown_Person
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_000_CUT_000_011.text:
I should have expected no less from
Terra's Scion. In any case, I'll be taking
the power of the spirits from you now.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_006_030.speaker: Erytheia
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_006_030.text:
Come on, lighten up a bit!
There's no problem I can't
sort out for you.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_009_010.speaker: Byaku
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_009_010.text: You mean to say we part ways here?

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_009_030.speaker: Byaku
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_009_030.text:
Indeed. Come! We've yet to achieve
what we set out to do.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_010_010.speaker: Nitram
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_010_010.text:
Do you not require the strength
of the Four Tribes, Soul Voyager?

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_014_010.speaker: Azure
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_014_010.text:
Surely you do not mean to say our voyage
ends here, sailor from an outer ocean.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_014_030.speaker: Azure
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_014_030.text:
Deus Maris's blessing is upon you.
Abandon fear and press ever onward.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_015_010.speaker: Ivar
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_015_010.text:
Ye can't mean to say our voyage is
comin' to an end here, wee minnow.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_015_030.speaker: Ivar
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_015_030.text:
Aye, yer instinct is a sharp thing indeed,
but I'm sure as the sea is blue that there's
nothin' we can't handle.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_016_010.speaker: Gruman_Mole
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_016_010.text:
What!? You're not done feeding
me yummies, are you!?

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_016_030.speaker: Gruman_Mole
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_016_030.text:
Yaaay! Boy, I hope Miyako City
has big, juicy worms!

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_017_010.speaker: Guinevere
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_017_010.text:
You would have us part ways here?
I cannot yet return to Avalon.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_017_030.speaker: Guinevere
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_017_030.text:
It's possible that whatever you're up against
is far greater than you could possibly imagine...
But you don't need to hear that from me.
Forget I said anything.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_018_010.speaker: Mech_Bard
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_018_010.text:
You would leave me here? Woe!
Profound sadness! I've no choice
but to self-detonate in despair!

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_018_030.speaker: Mech_Bard
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_018_030.text:
A 'bad feeling,' is it? Magnificent!
Rejoice and weep tears of gratitude
at my feet, for I shall make our tale
into an epic poem!

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_019_010.speaker: Nana
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_019_010.text:
What? You mean...you're not
going to guide me anymore?

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_019_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_019_030.text:
Yeesh, how is it that my Soyay always
manages to find their way into trouble?
At least things are never boring.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_021_010.speaker: Scarecrow
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_021_010.text:
Then this scarecrow shall
return to the desert!

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_021_030.speaker: Scarecrow
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_021_030.text:
Then this scarecrow shall
return to Miyako City!

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_022_010.speaker: Simon
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_022_010.text:
I suppose it simply wouldn't do to
have a machine of war like myself
causing a fuss in your homeland.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_022_030.speaker: Simon
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_022_030.text:
Let's hope your bad feeling doesn't
turn out to be any more than just
a feeling.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_023_010.speaker: Kina_Kikiri
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_023_010.text:
You would deny me the pleasure of seeing
the former Soyay's homeland!? How cruel!
I was so looking forward to seeing what kinds
of fiends inhabited it!

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_023_030.speaker: Kina_Kikiri
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_023_030.text:
Hurrah! The thought of seeing the fiends
that made the former Soyay as strong as
they are gives me chills.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_024_010.speaker: Lancelot
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_024_010.text:
Perhaps it would be discourteous
for me to simply invite myself into
your precious homeland.

SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_024_030.speaker: Lancelot
SUB_C01_DOOR_MIDO_RETURN_100_CUT_024_030.text:
Should you desire assistance,
I shall answer the call. For such
is what it means to be a knight.
